comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
No need to redefine the PATH here, its the same as the parent class's path. All this does is introduce extra work if the JSP path changes, you need to change in 1.......M places.
Instead, remove this and referenence eavePlanAddPage_AbsenceReasons_PlanProof.PATH in the getPageLoadCondition() below (you may need to make that protected if its currently private)

comments.author: Anita Marwah
Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: a method like this lives in LeavePlanAddPage_AbsenceReasons_PlanProof which you could use as this page extends from there

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: Too many comments - you might need to check your formatter

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
Incorrect naming for all newly added string array. THIS_NAME_IMPLIES_JAVA_STATIC_CONSANT, whereas thisNameIsHowVariablesShouldBeNamed
See https://www.thoughtco.com/g00/using-java-naming-conventions-2034199

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Can we not use the master intake DTO?

comments.author: Anita Marwah
comments.comment: yes, we can. However, it will be required to update its 16 references in multiple tests. Hence, creating another JIRA task to work on it separately. http://jira/browse/FAB-5018

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: it's nice not too have to pass page objects to methods. Could all these lines / methods be combined into a navigateToEvidenceTab

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: I know you had problems with addRow before but would it have been possible to use it here and therefore the normal listview validation method could be used.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
These 3 lines exist in four places now:
com.fineos.absence.selenium.pages.LeavePlanAddPage_AbsenceReasons.searchAndAddDocumentType
com.fineos.absence.selenium.pages.LeavePlanAddPage_AbsenceReasons_PlanProof.addDocumentTypeToAbsenceReason
com.fineos.absence.selenium.pages.LeavePlanEditPage_AbsenceReasons_PlanProof.addDocumentTypeToAbsenceReason
com.fineos.absence.selenium.pages.ProofDocumentAddPage.addProofDocumentToReasonElectives
Really, they belong on DocumentTypeManagerSearchPage_DocumentTypeFolder class, since they are functions of that page. Could we extend DocumentTypeManagerSearchPage_DocumentTypeFolder to add them, or create a support class that accepts an instance DocumentTypeManagerSearchPage_DocumentTypeFolder and had this (I know Tom says you should pass page to support class, as teh method just be on the page, but here we dont own teh page, as its in the FWK). Can you chat with Tom about a small refactor/>

comments.author: Anita Marwah
comments.comment: As discussed with Tom, cretaed below mentioned pages in absence-selenium and then created method on DocumentTypeManagerSearchPage_DocumentTypeFolder page to add documents. com.fineos.absence.selenium.pages.DocumentTypeManagerSearchPage_DocumentTypeFolder com.fineos.absence.selenium.pages.DocumentTypeManagerSearchPage

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
Why did you change all these comments from /** **/
to
/* */
style? The former is correct javadoc standard, so that when you hover over the method/constant name OUTSIDE this class, the description appears, without you needing to open in. Please revert this change.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
No javadoc to say why this exists.
Why does it exist?! This seems to be identical to the DocumentTypeManagerSearchPage from selenium FWK? this class seems redundant, delete it please. See comment below about DocumentTypeManagerSearchPage_DocumentTypeFolder.
Please read https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/IandI/subclasses.html

Upon further inspection, every other implementation of IEligibilityRule has a duplicate constant of ZERO. Code reu-use?!

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: This is just a copy/paste of the class javadoc (as it has the same grammar errors). No need to put it in two places.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: "Following are the status" doesnt make sense. Expand this to say that "The status of the returned result is set as follows:"

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: "at at worksite" is wrong, should be "at the worksite". Similarly is should be "within the state/organisation"

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: As above - "at at worksite" is again wrong as is "within state"

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
"within" is one word. Sentence doesn make sense, change to
NOT KNOWN - If the plan does not specify the worksite or the state in which the employee is requesting leave.
Missing closing <li> tag, as well as closing </ul> tag

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
Ugh, every single rule that implements IEligibilityRule has this logic :-( There is no need for this method. There should be a RuleEligibilityResultPersistenceService that has a createRuleEligibilityResult() method, called from each rule, passing the data.
You should refactor all other IEligibilityRules also.

comments.author: Mohan Pattabhiramaswamy
comments.comment:
Hi Trevor/ Mahendra
I have created a JIRA http://jira/browse/FAB-4985 for the implementation and tracking

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
Hi Trevor,
We had discussed these internally and thought of having an abstract implmentation of the IEligibilityRule that can provide a base implmentation of any rule. There were some oposition from few team members not to dilute the design intent (Strategy pattern) by having an abstract implmenation. So we kind of left it at that.
Again it was done this way for the first rule and then otehr rules have been following the same. Yes There is a similalrityu there and we will extract it to the abstract class. May be in the next sprint. We can discuss further if I missed anything.
@Mohan: Please create a Jira Technical debt and assign it to Taj. Lets take it forward in next sprint if possible. Keep this review id mentioned in the Jira too.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: This doesnt belong here, but EligibilityEvaluationService.populateEmployeeEligibilityDetails() has garbage code that is not exected, as you saw.......can you ask whoever wrote that to fix it? Ask them to create a JIRA and close this comment with that JIRA number then

comments.comment: A new JIRA http://jira/browse/FAB-4996 has been created

comments.author: Mahendra Dash

This is just a informatory comment.
Each time you add such long fields in the Domain interfaces, just check if they are in the correct sequence as per the Excel sheet.
I did it while reviewing. So for this no worries, but must take care for similar things.
No you can straight away drop this comment.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Incorrect naming convention. THINGS_NAMED_LIKE_THIS are static constants ONLY. Others MUST be variablesLikeThis, as per java coding conventions.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Possibly one for the separate tech debt JIra, but why do we have a no-arg constructor and setters on this? This would allow anyone to change teh values of RuleEligibilityResult after its created. Shouldnt we just have the constructor with 4 args, make the members final and remove teh setters? That would be much more secure.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
As I said already, you shouldnt be testing this here, you should just be mocking the call to populateEligibilityResult(), with the expected values, specifying the result, and validating that said result is returned is returned. Then there should be a separate test for populateEligibilityResult.
Otherwise you are repeating the 4 asserts in every single test, as you are doing now. You are testing too much here...
Is this part of http://jira/browse/FAB-4985?

comments.author: Mohan Pattabhiramaswamy
comments.comment:
There was no change in the logic. This change was made to address the comment http://iedev317.development.fineos.com/reviewboard/r/74766/#comment48680. After going through the comment and personally clarifying, there were 2 changes suggested, one is removing the 3 times explicit call for eligibilityRequirement.getEmployeesBasis() and fetching the value for employeeCountMap.get(eligibilityRequirement.getEmployeesBasis()). Since the second part of the change affected our functionality only the first part is retained as a part of this check in
Since the comment is only about storing a value in the variable instead of calling three times and not the logic,No test have been added

comments.comment:
Ugh, setters should be public, its only event handlers that are protected - I didnt say to change this to protected.
"All handler methods called from JSPs should be protected." - handler methods only i.e. navigateToSomePage(), returnFromNavigation() are all protected. getXX, getYY are public

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
There should be 1 separate method that creates an EvidenceResult. Now if we need this logic elsewhere, we cant use it, as its buried inside populateEvidenceResultData.
i.e. The code inside the inner for loop should exist in EvidenceResultService.createEvidenceResult(SelectedLeavePlan selectedLeavePlan, String docTypeName)
There should be tests specifically for that new method, and the populateEvidenceResultData should only test that the new method is called 1...M times, using partial mocking.

comments.comment: created a separate method createEvidenceResult(SelectedLeavePlan selectedLeavePlan, String docTypeName)

comments.comment:
Why doesnt this return the list of EvidenceResults that it created? What if the caller wants these, they are not available. Similar to comment about createEvidenceResult, any method that creates an object(s) should return them
Update javadoc to add @return List of created object, possibly empty, never null.
Update test to ensure you check the returned values

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
instead of "the", it should be "the count of". Else it creates some confusion.
How it can be interprited: the -> The employe who raised the Leave Request. count of -> The no of employes currently working in the organisation.

comments.author: Hiren Rana
comments.comment: Query is for returning the query to fetch OCPerson which is not count. But the interface API uses the query to return only the count. So interface API has comment to get the count of.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: It is still confusing to me.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: - Capitals in the begining of the line. - Do it for all the 3 inline comments.

comments.author: Hiren Rana
comments.comment: Only noun should start with Capital letter

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: Sentence must begin with a Capital letter.

comments.author: Hiren Rana
comments.comment: I donot agree it is not a full sentence. It is just the information. Also refer to existing queries.

reviewTimeLines.summary: FAB-4774 Query API to get the employees working for employer at given worksite

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: 1. "no of" / "count of" is missing

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: getEmployeesWorkingForOrganisationAtWorksiteCount -> getCountOfEmployeesWorkingForOrganisationAtWorksite

comments.author: Hiren Rana
comments.comment: I feel getEmployeesWorkingForOrganisationAtWorksiteCount is better name instead of using 'Of' preposition

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
By the time user reach to the word count in getEmployeesWorkingForOrganisationAtWorksiteCount he/she almost misses the meaning. My intention is not to just change the mwethod's name, but to make sure that the method gives a feel of what it does thrrough the method name quickly. So Count as the main thing you are returning should be there in the begining somewhere. Otherwise the current one looks like you are supposed to return Employees but retruning an integer instead.
How about: getNumberOfEmployeesWorkingForOrganisationAtWorksite? This will be inline with the rule name too.

comments.author: Hiren Rana
comments.comment: I still feel that getEmployeesWorkingForOrganisationAtWorksiteCount is appropriate. Moreover i confirmed with you on mail before naming the API methods. Also modifying it now will be overhaed to build FDP interface and then change the absence code which is consuming.

comments.author: Hiren Rana
comments.comment: getEmployeesWorkingForOrganisationAtWorksiteCount is fine from my persepective it explain clearly what method is trying to do.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
Bellow is the mail That you hade sent. Not sure if you are refering to anything else. If you dont want to make the code more redable and easily understandable, then I will not break my head for this. :)
------- Mail ------
Hi Mahendra,
Find below my comments inline. Also find the structure of APIs that will be exposed: getNoOfEmployeesWorkingForOrganisation(OrganisationEntity) getNoOfEmployeesWorkingForOrganisationAtWorksite(OrganisationEntity, PartyLocationAssociationEntity) getNoOfEmployeesWorkingForOrganisationAtState(OrganisationEntity, USState)
Regards, Hiren

comments.author: Hiren Rana
comments.comment: Also the Absence coding statndard tries to avoid preposition like 'of in method naming. If you feel otherwise then lets create a sub task in FAB-5001
